main event: An eyewitness account from a captain in the military describes a bright object falling at great speed near Ganoa, Italy, on June 7, 1959.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 3 to 4 minutes before it exploded and disappeared., Approximately 15 witnesses were present who reported feeling surprised and terrified., The sighting took place in a field in Cavalettoli, about 20 kilometers from Ganoa., A hand-drawn diagram depicting the object's trajectory was included in the report., The atmospheric conditions were noted as very clear and moonless at the time of observation.
witness description: A captain and tourist officer along with approximately 14 others
